post_text:
Not completely ready for school on Tuesday? We got you covered! We are at the building until 12:30 pm ready to pass out any curriculum items (e.g., textbooks and materials) and devices to any FULLY-REGISTERED student at Coleman School! Please make sure the parent or legal guardian has a state-issued photo ID and has completed the device agreement online.

We can't wait to see all our scholars again on Tuesday morning for a full day of learning!

Parents, have you downloaded the ParentSquare app? ParentSquare is app that teachers are using to communicate with parents and families of our scholars!

Contact us at the office if you are having any trouble with signing up. We want to make sure that you don't miss any messages about virtual learning!

Yes, Keenan, we couldn't agree more...

Welcome back to Coleman School, scholars, where we believe all of us are on our hero's journey! The 2020-2021 school year is underway, and our teachers are using today and this week to establish deep connections with scholars.

#welcomeback #herosjourney #colemanschool #schoolyear20202021 #virtuallearning #resilience #collaboration #joy #curiosity #excellence #corevalues #journeycommunityschools #5thgrade #memphis #raleigh

post_text:
Tomorrow begins the first day of school for the 2020-2021 school year!

Parents, you should have received a message from ParentSquare on Friday with important information. Please check your email, text, or voicemail for an important message.

Additionally, your child's homeroom teacher should have reached out to you with the information for this week's Zoom calls. Please let us know if you have not received the information so we can assist.

We are looking forward to a strong start tomorrow on each scholars' hero's journey!
text:
Tomorrow begins the first day of school for the 2020-2021 school year!

Parents, you should have received a message from ParentSquare on Friday with important information. Please check your email, text, or voicemail for an important message.

Additionally, your child's homeroom teacher should have reached out to you with the information for this week's Zoom calls. Please let us know if you have not received the information so we can assist.

We are looking forward to a strong start tomorrow on each scholars' hero's journey!

post_text: ATTENTION PARENTS: We apologize for the short notice, but we were just made aware of this event. If you are in need, please consider going to this event tomorrow morning into the afternoon!
text: ATTENTION PARENTS: We apologize for the short notice, but we were just made aware of this event. If you are in need, please consider going to this event tomorrow morning into the afternoon!

post_text: Don't forget.... you can start picking up curriculum materials starting tomorrow morning through Friday evening THIS WEEK! We want 100% of our scholars prepared for the upcoming school year with everything they need!
text: Don't forget.... you can start picking up curriculum materials starting tomorrow morning through Friday evening THIS WEEK! We want 100% of our scholars prepared for the upcoming school year with everything they need!

post_text:
Because we are social distancing, we're moving our orientation sessions to Zoom this year! Hear from your child's teachers, learn how to log in safely to their device, understand our grading policy and how we will take attendance, and so much more!

We will send out the information on ParentSquare. If you have not signed up for a ParentSquare account yet, no worries! Contact us here at the school to stay informed.

We look forward to seeing you at the orientations next week, and if you are unable to make it, we will be sure to record it for you to review on your own time!
text:

We will send out the information on ParentSquare. If you have not signed up for a ParentSquare account yet, no worries! Contact us here at the school to stay informed.

We look forward to seeing you at the orientations next week, and if you are unable to make it, we will be sure to record it for you to review on your own time!

post_text:
ATTENTION STUDENTS AND PARENTS!!! We are THRILLED to let you know we are ready to distribute curriculum materials to you starting next TUESDAY, AUGUST 25TH starting at 8:00 am! [Please note: Technology distribution will NOT be happening at Coleman School. We hope to have the tech distribution schedule to you by Tuesday, August 25th, as well!]

In order to pick up textbooks, workbooks, and supplies, your child will need to be FULLY REGISTERED for the 2020-2021 school year! If you have a question about that, please call the school at (901) 568-7068 and ask to speak with Mrs. Moore or Mr. Jones.

We cannot wait to begin the school year with you virtually on August 31st! Please make sure you make arrangements to pick-up your curriculum materials before then so you're good to go on the 31st!

post_text:
Happy Monday, Coleman School Wildcats! Here's your weekly enrollment update!

Coleman School welcomes any and all families that would like to work together to pave pathways to success to enroll and register their scholar for the 2020-2021 school year. When you a FULLY REGISTERED, you reserve your child's individual laptop and curriculum resources so they are fully prepared on the first day of school, August 31st!

Stay tuned for all the details on when and how we will pass out all materials!

post_text:
Coleman School welcomes any and all families that would like to work together to pave pathways to success to enroll and register their scholar for the 2020-2021 school year. YOU MUST REGISTER EVEN IF YOU CHOOSE TO DO AT HOME LEARNING USING VIRTUAL SCHOOL! YOU MUST REGISTER BY JULY 24TH!!!

When you register your scholar, you reserve their individual laptops and curriculum resources so they can continue to learn no matter if you choose the in-person or fully virtual option! We've got you covered!

Help us reach our goal of having 100% of students registered by July 31st! You can make this happen, parents and families!

post_text: Coleman School has many talented poets, artists, essayists, and musicians. We hope you’ll consider submitting a piece.
shared_text:
Paul Garner
July 24 at 10:58 AM ·

Do you have elementary, middle, or high school students in your household? Don't miss this awesome opportunity from Stand for Children - Tennessee!

"Creative expression can be a beneficial way for us to process and respond to traumatic experiences during this time of uncertainty.

That's why we're hosting the This is 2020: Meaningful Stories, Artful Healing competition to allow students in grades K-5, middle, and high school an opportunity to express their views on the global pandemic and racial injustice that plague our communities in Memphis and Shelby County.

Submission Deadline: Midnight Friday, August 7th.

Finalists from each grade level and their submission will be virtually showcased…

Good morning, Coleman School Wildcats! This is a reminder that on-site registration is still available for you to register your scholar! Registering your child now ensures that we have a laptop and curriculum resources for your child no matter what learning option you choose for them.

Please set up your appointment by calling the school at (901) 567-7068 or emailing djones@myjourneycs.org. The registration process takes approximately 10-15 minutes.

Thank you, and we cannot wait to welcome our scholars back to learning this fall!

post_text:
Happy Friday, Coleman School family and friends! It’s #WorldEmojiDay, and what better way to celebrate than leaving an emoji in the comments about how you feel to have made it through the week! Go ahead and do it now so we can see your favorite emoji.

As a reminder, we know that these are difficult times, but we love you and are here for you. If you have a pressing concern, always feel free to reach out to us at the school at 901.567.7068. We are still offering on-site registration for the upcoming school year and are happy to help you register over the phone to get started.

Have a great weekend, Wildcats!

post_text:
A HUGE THANK YOU to the Memphis Dream Center and The Life Church for making the first drop off and stocking up of the Coleman School food pantry! The volunteers and staff truly demonstrated Journey Community Schools' core values of Collaboration, Excellence, and Joy today.

This partnership has allowed us to create an in-school food pantry that can help as many as 10 families in our school community each week! The pantry will be stocked every Thursday and the food will be distributed on Fridays. We want to service different families each week, unless the same families apply every week. Parents will be able to apply for a bag Monday-Wednesday of each week as well.

Families are selected only if their scholars are fully registered and their waiver has been completed.

If you are interested, please contact the school at (901) 568-7068 so we can make sure your child is fully registered and you have completed the waiver.

post_text:
Wow! Thank you to every single parent that showed up yesterday and today to register their scholar for the upcoming school year! Almost every single grade saw a 10% increase in the number of students registered!

The good news is that we still have several slots open in each grade level for your son or daughter to begin their explorer's journey at Coleman School! We want to get to 100% enrollment by the end of the month, and we are quite close!

We welcome any and all families that would like to work together to pave pathways to success to enroll and register their scholar for the 2020-2021 school year.

As a reminder, when you register your scholar, you reserve their individual laptops and curriculum resources so they can continue to learn no matter if you choose the in-person or fully virtual option! We've got you covered!

post_text:
ON-SITE REGISTRATION REMINDER! Drop by our building (3210 Raleigh Millington) Monday-Friday between 9 a.m. - 3 p.m. to get your student registered for the upcoming school year. To set up a specific time to come by in that time window, give us a call at 901.567.7068 and we’ll schedule a time with you.

Documents needed for registration: Child’s social security card, child’s birth certificate, child’s vaccination record, guardian’s photo ID, and two proofs of address.

We look forward to see you soon and getting you ready for the year ahead!

#HerosJourney #JourneyCommunitySchools #ColemanSchool #PavingPathwaysToSuccess

post_text: For your information.
shared_text:
Shelby County Schools - SCS
July 13 at 8:00 AM ·

The SCS School Board will be conducting a Special Called Meeting on Monday, July 13 at 4 p.m. As practiced at all SCS Board Business/Special Called Meetings, a Public Comment Submission period will open prior to the start of the meeting. Any citizen interested in providing public comment for this Special Called Meeting must submit their comment through email at BoardPublicComments@scsk12.org, between 2:00 p.m. and 3:15 p.m. on the day of the meeting.

Please include your name, home address, organization represented, if any, and subject of your comment in the email. Comments will not be read unless these items are included.

*Comments will be read in the order in which they are received, and in accordance with Board Policy 0000 School Board Meetings: IV Public Comment. Public comments will share the 30-minute time slot, in equal increments of time, not to exceed three (3) minutes each. In the event that a public comment is not read in its entirety within the individual allotted time, a full copy will be accessible to the Board.
text:
For your information.

Shelby County Schools - SCS
July 13 at 8:00 AM ·

The SCS School Board will be conducting a Special Called Meeting on Monday, July 13 at 4 p.m. As practiced at all SCS Board Business/Special Called Meetings, a Public Comment Submission period will open prior to the start of the meeting. Any citizen interested in providing public comment for this Special Called Meeting must submit their comment through email at BoardPublicComments@scsk12.org, between 2:00 p.m. and 3:15 p.m. on the day of the meeting.

Please include your name, home address, organization represented, if any, and subject of your comment in the email. Comments will not be read unless these items are included.

*Comments will be read in the order in which they are received, and in accordance with Board Policy 0000 School Board Meetings: IV Public Comment. Public comments will share the 30-minute time slot, in equal increments of time, not to exceed three (3) minutes each. In the event that a public comment is not read in its entirety within the individual allotted time, a full copy will be accessible to the Board.

post_text:
Coleman School is fortunate to have a partnership with Memphis Dream Center and the FeedMemphis Food Pantry to help out our families that are experiencing a food shortage. This partnership has allowed us to create an in-school food pantry that can help as many as 10 families in our school community each week!

The pantry will be stocked every Thursday starting July 16th, and the food will be distributed on Fridays. We want to service different families each week, unless the same families apply every week. Parents will be able to apply for a bag Monday-Wednesday of each week as well.

Families are selected only if their scholars are fully registered and their waiver has been completed.

If you are interested, please contact the school at (901) 568-7068 so we can make sure your child is fully registered and you have completed the waiver.

post_text:
“Impossible is just a big word thrown around by small men who find it easier to live in the world they’ve been given than to explore the power they have to change it.” -Aimee Lehto

At Coleman School, we fearlessly show what is POSSIBLE when our students are able to explore the world on their hero’s journey. Simply put, we prepare students to change the world.

Register your scholar today so they can start their hero’s journey immediately.

#MotivationMonday #WiseWords #QuotesToLiveBy #TruerWordsNeverSpoken
